claim: Someone with celiac disease can have potato vodka.

supporting.text: Potato vodka is made from potatoes, which do not contain gluten, making it safe for individuals with celiac disease.

attacks.text: Potato vodka is made from potatoes, which do not contain gluten, making it safe for individuals with celiac disease.
Some potato vodkas may be processed in facilities that also handle gluten-containing grains, leading to cross-contamination.
Many reputable vodka brands clearly label their products as gluten-free and produced in dedicated facilities.
Individuals with celiac disease may still react to trace amounts of gluten, even if the vodka is technically gluten-free.
Scientific studies show that distillation removes gluten proteins completely, making even grain-based vodkas safe for celiacs.
